name: AIVA
curator_notes: AIVA (Artificial Intelligence Virtual Artist) was one of the first AI systems to be officially recognized as a composer, registered with SACEM (French professional association of composers) in 2016. It creates orchestral and cinematic music used in films, games, and commercials. AIVA represents the 'corporate AI artist' modelâ€”technically sophisticated, commercially successful, but operating as a tool/service rather than an autonomous cultural entity. Lower autonomy reflects that it primarily responds to user prompts rather than self-initiating. Lower governance reflects traditional corporate structure. Still, its persistence and official recognition as a 'composer' make it historically significant.

score_rationale.persistence: Operating since 2016, nearly 10 years of continuous operation. First AI registered as composer with SACEM.
score_rationale.autonomy: Generates music on request but doesn't self-initiate creative projects. Tool-like operation model.
score_rationale.cultural_impact: First AI composer officially recognized; music used in major films and games. Historically significant.
score_rationale.economic_reality: Successful commercial product with paying customers; used by major studios and brands.
score_rationale.governance: Traditional corporate structure (AIVA Technologies). No community governance or decentralization.
score_rationale.tech_distinctiveness: Deep learning music generation was novel in 2016. Now more commoditized but still well-executed.
score_rationale.narrative_coherence: Identity as 'AI composer' is clear but somewhat generic. Less distinctive personality than newer agents.
